oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Growth and paraconductivity of Tl2Ba2CaCu2O8+x single crystals
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHOWDHURY, P
BHATIA, SN
SEN, S
MUTHE, KP
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have grown single crystal's of Tl2Ba2CaCu2O8+x by self flux method These crystals are characterized by XRD and resistivity measurements under magnetic fields up to II: The out-of-plane resistivity was measured by standard four probe technique. The out-of-plane resistivity increases with decreasing temperature up to the superconducting onset temperature and then suddenly drops to zero with a peak at a temperature T-in. Also we observed that the presence of the magnetic field perpendicular to the ab-plane enhances tills peak and shifts it towards lower temperatures. Such a peak can be explained with the help of the thermodynamic fluctuations of order parameter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 41st DAE Solid State Physics Symposium,KURUKSHETRA, INDIA,DEC 27-31, 1998
